instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ram socket problems?
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> has some common ram socket problems? Support 8GB?
Sometimes working on videos on youtube beeps 3 times and freeze.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ram socket problems?
threads.message: Probably one bad socket, usually the one you put the RAM in first. Max. out the good slot, the one closest to the bottom of the machine. Not fixable.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ram socket problems?
threads.message: Now appears artefacts when touch the board or make pression here and there. Could be the mux?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ram socket problems?
threads.message: Usually the MUX on these yes. Should not lock up or crash of course!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ram socket problems?
threads.message: Reflow is ok, or need replaced?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ram socket problems?
threads.message: MUX can be reflowed but need to very carefully remove ALL the glue. If you mess this up it will be reball time and that sucks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ram socket problems?
